channel.title: Fullscreen Client
channel.description:
What do you think of the new client coming out? Are you going to deobfuscate it? Emulate a server?
Discuss. :D

item.title: Fullscreen Client
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:28, topic:213007”][quote author=codeusa link=topic=280456.msg2287092#msg2287092 date=1213961719]

It’s also so hard to read the sentence “like we have in funorb”.
Funorb has an option, to goto full screen. It’s not stand alone client, to do such.

He, said “like we have done with fun orb games”
[/quote]
And FunOrb probably does use Applets, considering they use JavaScript to launch the game.

[code]

[/code][/quote]
The presence of javascript is completely independent of whether they use a java applet or not. While injecting the applet tags via javascript may speed things up the reason behind it is to prevent easy scrapping of pages. That is a huge hurdle for non-browser based bots.

Read full topic

item.title: Fullscreen Client
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

It also writes the options, so they don’t have to hard code it when changing things. (Like world, detail, java version etc)
Javascript is more flexible then html

Read full topic

item.title: Fullscreen Client
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Doesn’t that just have a document.write("") etc etc? I think it allows the page to load, and the html to render, then it injects the applet tags into the html. That way the applet doesn’t load off to the side of the screen at first because the Java plugin freezes the browser and therefore the page rendering.

Read full topic

item.title: Fullscreen Client
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Zachera:

I think I’m going to take one more adventure around the world map… one last time.

Just to bring back the good memories.
I will probably do that too when the update comes around.
See how good of a job they did … OR did not…

.Kyle ;[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 17, 2008, 12:15:39 PM[/size][hr][quote=“x19, post:4, topic:213007”]Its going to be made into a wow type client, were you download it.[/quote]

Are you … SERIOUS?! … Wow…
What I really think is that , that’s not
even runescape anymore. It’s just not the same a couple
years ago. I miss the good old memories in the Runescape Classic days :(.

Read full topic

item.title: Fullscreen Client
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:17, topic:213007”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=280456.msg2280907#msg2280907 date=1213681776]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=280456.msg2280854#msg2280854 date=1213679500]

My money is on the fact they are going to make use of JNLP (Java WebStart) to launch the full screen client. My reasoning behind that is they still want to make money off of their ads, as the majority of RS players will start using the full screen client. But either way, it is not very hard to get the loader from the *.jnlp file (simple HEX editing, or even opening the file in NotePad, could reveal the path to the loader), so I’m also going to assume their going to add a few more checks into the loader preventing it from being run directly off your computer.
[/quote]Why THE FUCK Hex-Edit it when you can open it in notepad?
[/quote]Personal preference. Anyways, it doesn’t matter what you use. No need to react like that.

Why the fuck would you prefer staring over hex, than a simple fucking XML file? It makes no sense.[/quote]It was a simple suggestion that first came to mind (as I was using one recently). Then I realized using a simple text editor would be better, and added that to the post. There’s no need to act up like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Fullscreen Client
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Zachera:

My money is on the WebStart client, but then again, many people are VERY picky about what they download these days…

Especially after all of Jagex’s brainwashing about downloading, they’ll probably have to conceive a way to get the client to the public without having them “download” something.

Read full topic

item.title: Fullscreen Client
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Applets suck because the browser plugin sucks, which Sun recently fixed and will be distributing in the near future. It is now modularized so it just downloads things as it needs it, as well as being a separate process so it won’t tie up the browser.

Read full topic

item.description:
